data.title: Match Supply and Demand in Service Industries
data.meta_description: What makes service industries so distinct from manufacturing ones is their immediacy: the hamburgers have to be hot, the motel rooms exactly where the sleepy travelers want them, and the airline seats empty when the customers want to fly. Balancing the supply and demand sides of a service industry is not easy, and whether a [â€¦]
data.text:
WS

W. Earl Sasser is a Baker Foundation Professor and the chair of the Program for Leadership Development at Harvard Business School.
